thread.title: Era moves to 3-0 in district, Sacred Heart stops Lubbock Christian
thread.title_full: Era moves to 3-0 in district, Sacred Heart stops Lubbock Christian

author: EVAN GRICE Sports Editor
title: Era moves to 3-0 in district, Sacred Heart stops Lubbock Christian
text:
Staff photo by Evan Grice Staying golden 
Era quarterback Jackson Lane finished with three touchdowns on the night Friday against Celeste as the Hornets moved to 3-0 in district play with a 36-7 victory at Hornet Stadium in Era. Posted: Saturday, October 10, 2015 1:10 am Era moves to 3-0 in district, Sacred Heart stops Lubbock Christian By EVAN GRICE Sports Editor gainesvilleregister.com 
Don’t look now, but there’s a surprise team atop the district standings in class 2A. 
The Era Hornets, at least for a short time are at the top of the heap following their third straight district victory, this time a 36-7 victory over Celeste at Hornet Stadium Friday night. 
Tannice Fuller got the scoring started with a 10-yard touchdown run before Jackson Lane added the two point conversion to make it 8-0 at the 8:11 mark of the first quarter. 
Lane then made it 14-0 with 8:39 left before halftime as he scored from 10-yards out, sending the Hornets into the break with a lead. 
CHS did manage to cut the lead to 14-7 in the third quarter, but Lane wouldn’t be denied as he ran for another touchdown, this time from 30 yards out to make it 22-7 after the two-point conversion. 
It would be Lane once again in the fourth scoring another 30-yard touchdown, before Fuller finished the game off with a 44-yard touchdown to ice the game. 
EHS (3-3, 3-0) will have next Friday night off before returning to action Oct. 23 against the Lindsay Knights. 
Sacred Heart 28 
Lubbock Christian 7 
All good things come to those who wait, and for the Sacred Heart Tigers they can now breathe a sigh of relief in district play. 
SHS broke open a 14-7 halftime lead with 14 more points in the second half to claim a 28-7 victory deep in West Texas Friday night. 
Kason Reeves got the Tigers on the board with a two-yard touchdown run at the 5:24 mark of the first, before Lubbock Christian tied the game in the second quarter. 
Reeves then got another touchdown before halftime from two yards out, before adding a third in the third quarter on a 47-yard pass to Zach Flusche. 
Ethan Henry finished the game off in the third with a six yard touchdown run. 
Henry was the leading rusher for the Tigers with 12 carries for 75 yards, while Reeves finished 9-of-20 passing for 141 yards and one touchdown. 
Sacred Heart (3-3, 1-2) will be hosting Fellowship Academy next Friday night at 7:30 p.m. from Tiger Stadium. 
Callisburg 22 Pilot Point 18 
Tanner Thurman had never had the chance to defeat Pilot Point as a member of the Callisburg varsity football team in his career. 
That was until Friday night. 
With 30 seconds left in the fourth quarter, Thurman carved his name into Wildcat football history as he scored the game winning touchdown to give Callisburg its first victory at Massey Stadium since 2002 over the Pilot Point Bearcats. 
With the score nodded at 15-15 at the halftime break, PPHS went ahead with a field goal in the fourth quarter, before CHS struck back and claimed a crucial district opening victory. 
Reece Richey and Chase Caldwell added the other touchdowns on the evening for Callisburg (6-0, 1-0) which will now prepare for a showdown next Friday night with No. 8 Pottsboro with kickoff set for 7:30 p.m. from Wildcat Stadium. 
Valley View 44 Bells 14 
If there was ever such a thing as a giant step towards a district title, the Valley View Eagles took it Friday night on the road. 
VVHS used a strong 31-0 lead at the halftime break to overpower the Bells Panthers and claim a district opening win 44-14. 
Rusty Shell, Riley Willis and JD Johnson all finished with a pair of touchdowns on the evening for the Eagles. 
VVHS (3-3, 1-0) will be back at John Kassen Field next Friday night for a district contest against Trenton at 7:30 p.m. 
Whitesboro 28 Van Alstyne 26 
For the Whitesboro Bearcats, they picked the perfect time to end a four-game losing streak Friday night at Panther Stadium. 
WHS escaped the Van Alstyne Panthers in the district opening game with a narrow 28-26 victory, improving the Bearcats to 2-4 and 1-0 in district play. 
The Bearcats will host Farmersville next Friday night at 7:30 p.m.
